sentences: Drora Bruck (born December 31, 1966 in Haifa, Israel) is an Israeli recorder player.
Drora Bruck graduated from the Jerusalem Academy of Music and Dance, where she studied with Michael Meltzer, for her BMus which was obtained in 1990.
Bruck went on to study in the Civica Scuola di Musica in Milan with Pedro Memelsdorff after winning a scholarship from the Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

Since 2014 Drora is a lecturer in the Department of Music, in The Givat Washington College, israelBruck has performed and recorded works written for her, from solo pieces to chamber music with voice, guitar, piano, string quartet and electronic sounds.
